abstract: American Pharmacists Assn adopts policy discouraging members from providing death-penalty drugs, potentially making it more difficult for states seeking to buy custom-made execution drugs from compounding pharmacies.
lead_paragraph: The guidelines could make it tough for death penalty states that have been looking at made-to-order execution drugs from compounding pharmacies to solve a shortage of execution drugs.

headline.main: California: Policy Adopted Against Execution Drugs
headline.print_headline: California: Policy Adopted Against Execution Drugs

snippet: The guidelines could make it tough for death penalty states that have been looking at made-to-order execution drugs from compounding pharmacies to solve a shortage of execution drugs.
